channel.title: Not having a default browser and pressing on "Web Browser" icon in xfce will give annoying bug
channel.description:
Since we dont have a default browser by default so any user who is morphing debian fresh install he will not have a browser as well (specially debian minimal version like netinst or CD..etc).
This will give annoying show annoying bug:
![havingnobrowser1|609x295](upload://gFxcnUt4rokXKf3uWEgeOTvY5Au.png)
Will show a bug window which you need to press on OK multiple times to disappear:
1 ![havingnobrowser2|620x153](upload://gX2EIkkvPcBMC759OjAQD2M5JsL.png) 2 ![havingnobrowser3|625x149](upload://k1Qtw2gfTFjltczWnhg31T0taAM.png) 3 ![havingnobrowser4|624x149](upload://5OgaIEIfVayVmT8oXEVYar6D3dH.png) 4 ![havingnobrowser5|625x156](upload://AobqDXOQyV4RHZDnJWvPY3V5v5L.png) 5 ![havingnobrowser6|623x149](upload://zQenkdh8HXOqpHCHQurcR6F18ql.png)

item.title: Not having a default browser and pressing on "Web Browser" icon in xfce will give annoying bug
item.dc:creator: nurmagoz
item.description:
Patrick Schleizer:

Also solved by this?

Yes, because firefox installed by default.

Read full topic
item.source: Not having a default browser and pressing on "Web Browser" icon in xfce will give annoying bug

item.title: Not having a default browser and pressing on "Web Browser" icon in xfce will give annoying bug
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Also solved by this?

Add pyqt5-dev-tool dependency to kicksecure dependencies Development
Root cause is that meta package kicksecure-desktop-applications-recommended isn’t installed. That package would ensure that the dependency package repository-dist-wizard gets installed. I’ve updated the installation instructions just now: Here’s the change: Debian: Difference between revisions - Kicksecure

Read full topic
